name: Gaia Sky
tagline: Gaia Sky, 3D visualisation software for ESA's Gaia satellite and astronomy outreach
body:
### Gaia Sky
The **Gaia Sky** is a real-time, 3D, astronomy visualisation software that runs on Windows, Linux and OS X. It is developed in the framework of ESA's [Gaia mission](sci.esa.int/gaia) to chart about 1 billion stars of our Galaxy in the Gaia group of the Astronomisches Rechen-Institut (ZAH, Universität Heidelberg).

### Download
[Download the Gaia Sky now!](https://zah.uni-heidelberg.de/?id=660)

### Main features
-  **Free and open source** - The application is free and open source and will stay this way. You can even contribute to the development or the translations.
-  **From Gaia to the cosmos** - Move freely through the cosmos and descend on the surface of the Moon or close-up inspect the Gaia satellite. All movement is seamless!
-  **Gaia** - Observe Gaia in its orbit and discover its movement in the sky and its attitude.
-  **3D ready** - With 3 stereoscopic modes: VR headset, 3DTV, cross-eye.
-  **Use your own data!** - Support for VOTable, FITS, csv and all formats supported by STIL.
-  **Navigate the galaxy** - Support for controllers and gamepads makes navigating the Galaxy a piece of cake.
-  **Record and play your paths** - Ready to record and play camera paths off-the-shelf.
-  **Scriptable and moddable** - Use Python to script and extend it!
-  **Internationalised** - Supports English, German, Spanish and Catalan.

### Documentation
[Gaia Sky Wiki](https://github.com/ari-zah/gaiasky/wiki) - We have all the most up-to-date documentation in our wiki. It continually grows, so stay tuned!
[Gaia Sky javadoc](http://wwwstaff.ari.uni-heidelberg.de/gaiasandbox/javadoc/) - The current javadoc of the project. Not always up to date.
